SEARCH
Package gw.plugin.addressautocomplete

Interface IAddressAutocompletePlugin

All Superinterfaces:
InternalPlugin, Remote
All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultAddressAutocompletePlugin
public interface IAddressAutocompletePlugin extends InternalPlugin
Plugin for address auto complete/auto fill. These methods are called from static methods in AddressAutocompleteUtil.
Author:
jfehrle

  • Field Details

    • SUGGESTION_LIMIT

      static final int SUGGESTION_LIMIT

  • Method Details

    • autofillAddress

      void autofillAddress(AddressFillable address, String triggerField, boolean alwaysOverride)
      Autofills the address if there is a unique match.
      Parameters:
      address - the address to autofill.
      triggerField - name of the address field that triggered the autofill.
      alwaysOverride - if true, override the existing value with the match for every address field (note, it could be null). If false, existing value for the field will not be overridden if the match is null.

    • getAutofillValue

      Object getAutofillValue(Country country, String fieldName, String[] fieldNames, Object[] fieldValues, boolean doOverride, Integer triggerIndex)
      Gets the value for the specified address field named fieldName based on address auto-fill configuration. Use this API if the country does not trigger reflection and is therefore not passed in the list of fields.
      Parameters:
      country - the country; this is ignored if the array of fields passed in contains the country
      fieldName - the name of the field to autofill
      fieldNames - an array of the names of the fields on the address whose values will be used to determine the autofill value.
      fieldValues - an array of values of the fields on the address; there is a one-to-one correlation between the fieldNames and fieldValues
      doOverride - if true, override the existing value even if it is not null
      triggerIndex - the index of the field that triggered the autofill.
      Returns:
      the value for the specified field, if there is a unique match or if there are multiple matches and one of the matches matches the current value.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the length of fieldNames does not equal the length of fieldValues.

    • getInputMask

      String getInputMask(AddressFillable address, String addressFieldName)
      Return the inputmask for the given address field; returns null if none defined.
      Parameters:
      address - the address
      addressFieldName - the address field name
      Returns:
      the input mask for the given address field

    • getInputMask

      String getInputMask(Country country, String addressFieldName)
      Parameters:
      country - country
      addressFieldName - the address field name
      Returns:
      the input mask for the given address field

    • validate

      String validate(AddressFillable address, String addressFieldName, String addressFieldLabel)
      Validate the address field's format and value. This validates the field's format against a validator (if defined) and also validates that the field matches the other fields in the address (based on zone data). Returns an error message if there is an error with the address field, otherwise, returns null.
      Parameters:
      address - the address
      addressFieldName - the name of the address field
      addressFieldLabel - the user-displayable field label to use in error meesage
      Returns:
      an error message if there is an error with the address field, otherwise, returns null.

    • verifyFieldFormat

      String verifyFieldFormat(AddressFillable address, String addressFieldName, String addressFieldLabel)
      Validate the address field's format. This validates the field against a validator (if defined). Returns an error message if there is an error with the address field, otherwise, returns null.
      Parameters:
      address - the address
      addressFieldName - the name of the address field
      addressFieldLabel - the user-displayable field label to use in error meesage
      Returns:
      an error message if there is an error with the address field, otherwise, returns null.

    • verifyFieldFormat

      String verifyFieldFormat(Country country, String addressFieldName, Object addressFieldValue)
      Validate the address field's format. This validates the field against a validator (if defined). Returns an error message if there is an error with the address field, otherwise, returns null.
      Parameters:
      country - country
      addressFieldName - the name of the address field
      addressFieldValue - the value of the address field
      Returns:
      an error message String if there is an error with the address field, otherwise, returns null.

    • verifyFieldValue

      String verifyFieldValue(AddressFillable address, String addressFieldName, String addressLabel)
      Validate the address field's value. This validates the field against a validator (if defined) and also validates that the field matches the other fields in the address. Returns an error message if there is an error with the address field, otherwise, returns null.
      Parameters:
      address - the address
      addressFieldName - the name of the address field
      Returns:
      true if the field validates, false otherwise.

    • isAddressAutofillAvailable

      boolean isAddressAutofillAvailable()
      Returns true if the address autofill is configured correctly.
      Returns:
      true if the address autofill is configured correctly.

    • getStates

      State[] getStates(Country country)
      Gets the states for the given country.
      Parameters:
      country - only states for the specified country are returned.
      Returns:
      an array of states

    • lookupZone

      Zone lookupZone(AddressFillable address, ZoneType zt, boolean uniqueOnly)
      Look up the zone of the given zone type based on other zones in the address. The lookup is determined by the lookup order defined in zone config.
      Parameters:
      address - the address
      zt - the zone type that is being looked up
      uniqueOnly - if true, only return the zone if it uniquely links to the zone being used in the lookup. If there is more than one match, then no zone is returned.
      Returns:
      the zone if found, null otherwise.

    • getZoneValue

      String getZoneValue(AddressFillable address, ZoneType zt)
      Evaluate the expression that is defined for the given zone type against a specific address
      Parameters:
      address - address
      zt - zone type
      Returns:
      the evaluated value

    • getValueRange

      Object[] getValueRange(Country country, String desiredFieldName, String[] fieldNames, Object[] fieldValues, Integer triggerIndex)
      Get the value range for the desired field; the value range will be filtered by the other address fields that are passed in. For example, if the desired field is State, and the city is 'Paris' (with all other fields being null), the result would be all States that have a city called 'Paris'.
      Parameters:
      country - the country; note that this is ignored if country is in the array of fields
      desiredFieldName - the name of the field whose value range is being calculated.
      fieldNames - the names of the fields use to filter the value range
      fieldValues - the values of the fields that are used to filter the value range
      triggerIndex - the field that triggered this autofill call.
      Returns:
      the value range for the desired field
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the trigger index is out of range OR if the length of fieldNames does not equal the length of fieldValues

    • getValueRange

      <T> List<T> getValueRange(String desiredFieldName, String triggerFieldName, AddressFillable addr, Object currentValue, Class<T> ofClass)
      Get the value range for the desired field; the value range will be filtered by the other address fields that are passed in. For example, if the desired field is State, and the city is 'Paris' (with all other fields being null), the result would be all States that have a city called 'Paris'.
      Parameters:
      desiredFieldName - the name of the field whose value range is being calculated.
      triggerFieldName - the field that is triggering the value range calculation.
      addr - the address from whose fields the value range will be calculated
      currentValue - the current value of the desired field.
      ofClass - the class type of the value
      Returns:
      the value range for the desired field
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the trigger index is out of range OR if the length of fieldNames does not equal the length of fieldValues

    • createAutocompleteHandler

      AutocompleteHandler createAutocompleteHandler(String addressFieldName, String[] additionalArgsNames, boolean waitForKeyPress)
      Create an AutocompleteHandler with the following arguments
      Parameters:
      addressFieldName - name of the field to autocomplete
      additionalArgsNames - list of field names used to generate suggestions
      waitForKeyPress - true indicates the autocomplete should wait for a user key press before fetching suggestions. This can have big performance implications, so it should only return false if there are a small, fixed number of possible suggestions.
      Returns:
